content.raw:
I don't think we should have a "World" item in the Model List.

Also, `max_step_size` and `real_time_update_rate` should be within the physics SDF block, not the world block.

The 'physics' block should be modified to support global properties that are relevant to Physics and engine specific properties. For example:


```
#!xml

<sdf version='1.4'>
  <world name='default'>
    <physics>
      <max_step_size>0.001</max_step_size>
      <real_time_update_rate>1000</real_time_update_rate>

      <engine type='ode'>
          All of the ODE parameters.
      </engine>

      <engine type='bullet'>
          All of the Bullet parameters.
      </engine>

      <engine type='simbody'>
          All of the SimBody parameters.
      </engine>

    </physics>
  </world>
</sdf>

```
content.html:
I don't think we should have a "World" item in the Model List.

Also, max_step_size and real_time_update_rate should be within the physics SDF block, not the world block.

The 'physics' block should be modified to support global properties that are relevant to Physics and engine specific properties. For example:

<sdf version='1.4'>
  <world name='default'>
    <physics>
      <max_step_size>0.001</max_step_size>
      <real_time_update_rate>1000</real_time_update_rate>

      <engine type='ode'>
          All of the ODE parameters.
      </engine>

      <engine type='bullet'>
          All of the Bullet parameters.
      </engine>

      <engine type='simbody'>
          All of the SimBody parameters.
      </engine>

    </physics>
  </world>
</sdf>

content.raw: ok we need to agree on where these properties should live. In issue #286, it was proposed that they should be in World so they could potentially be used to govern the update rate of modules other than physics. @scpeters, @hsu, thoughts?
content.html: ok we need to agree on where these properties should live. In issue #286, it was proposed that they should be in World so they could potentially be used to govern the update rate of modules other than physics. @scpeters, @hsu, thoughts?

content.raw:
This idea was from @hsujohnhsu and myself. It seemed at the time that step_size and update rate have an impact on subsystems other than physics, such as sensors (maybe sensors is the only one?). So it seemed like a conceptual thing to move it out of physics to the world.

It's optional, I guess, aside from the time it will take to change this pull request (sorry Ian).
content.html:
This idea was from @hsujohnhsu and myself. It seemed at the time that step_size and update rate have an impact on subsystems other than physics, such as sensors (maybe sensors is the only one?). So it seemed like a conceptual thing to move it out of physics to the world.

It's optional, I guess, aside from the time it will take to change this pull request (sorry Ian).

content.raw: I don't think sensors need the `max_step_size` or `real_time_update_rate` of the physics engine. Each sensor has it's own `update_rate` parameter.
content.html: I don't think sensors need the max_step_size or real_time_update_rate of the physics engine. Each sensor has it's own update_rate parameter.

content.raw: So looks like sensors will not need them now. Rendering should not share the same update rate as physics. so if everyone agrees, I will update the SDF descriptions.
content.html: So looks like sensors will not need them now. Rendering should not share the same update rate as physics. so if everyone agrees, I will update the SDF descriptions.

content.raw: I'm in; let's just make sure @hsujohnhsu is on board
content.html: I'm in; let's just make sure @hsujohnhsu is on board

content.raw: Talked to John, he thinks is ok too. Changes made in 15b645b
content.html: Talked to John, he thinks is ok too. Changes made in 15b645b

content.raw:
The pose tag here and in the child element below are new in sdf 1.4. These elements are currently specified as holding a value, but I don't think the element can hold a value as well as child elements. We should move the value of parent to a sub-element. For example:
~~~
<!-- in sdf 1.3 -->
<joint>
  <parent>upper_link</parent>
  <child>lower_link</child>
</joint>
~~~
would change to
~~~
<!-- in sdf 1.4 -->
<joint>
  <parent>
    <link_name>upper_link</link_name>
    <pose>1 2 3 4 5 6</pose>
  </parent>
  <child>
    <link_name>lower_link</link_name>
  </child>
</joint>
~~~
content.html:
The pose tag here and in the child element below are new in sdf 1.4. These elements are currently specified as holding a value, but I don't think the element can hold a value as well as child elements. We should move the value of parent to a sub-element. For example:

<!-- in sdf 1.3 -->
<joint>
  <parent>upper_link</parent>
  <child>lower_link</child>
</joint>

would change to

<!-- in sdf 1.4 -->
<joint>
  <parent>
    <link_name>upper_link</link_name>
    <pose>1 2 3 4 5 6</pose>
  </parent>
  <child>
    <link_name>lower_link</link_name>
  </child>
</joint>
